mainquest: Does your organisation have someone in charge of cybersecurity?
questa: What is this person's name, title, and contact information?
questb: Does this individual have the authority to shutdown all systems during a cyber attack?
questc: If not, who has this authority?

mainquest: Does your organisation have a  communication plan for a cyberattack?
questa: Does it outline how employees should report suspicious activity?
questb: Does it outline how information and updates regarding an attack will be shared internally and externally?
questc: Has the communication plan been tested for effectiveness?
questd: If so, can we see a copy of the results?

mainquest: Has your organisation been in touch with cyber security experts/advisors from outside your organizations regarding your planned response to a cyber attack?
questa: Have you already called on cyber security experts/advisors from outside your organizations in response to a cyber attack of any kind?
questb: Please describe the attack and how cyber security experts/advisors from outside your organizations offered assistance

mainquest: Has your organisation reached out to the government to discuss your cybersecurity plan and capabilities?
questa: If so, who is/was your contact in the government and what assistance did they provide?
questb: Does your organisation have a private cybersecurity consultant on call?
questd: What assistance have they already provided?

mainquest: Are there other local, regional, and national organizations your agency collaborates with to enhance your ability to avoid or deal with a cyberattack?
questb: What sort of relationship does your agency have with each of these partners?

mainquest: Does your organisation have a specific annual budget line item for cybersecurity?
questa: If so, what is the budget?
questb: What has been spent on cybersecurity improvements each of the past three years?
questc: Is there a budget set aside for next fiscal year?

mainquest: Does your organisation require cybersecurity awareness and best practices training for all new employees?
questa: Are continued refresher courses required for all employees on a regular basis?
questb: Are these provided online or in person? If online, who is the provider?
questc: What are the most important best practices that are taught?
queste: Who determines whether these practices are being followed successfully?

mainquest: Does your organisation have a detailed plan for dealing with the financial burdens a cyberattack might create?
questb: Does your organisation have cybersecurity insurance?
questc: If so, can we see the policy?
questd: How did you decide to buy insurance?
queste: Can we know what amount is paid per year for the insurance?
questg: Has your organisation received payments from this insurance?
questh: If so, please describe each instance and the amount received.
questi: If no insurance, why did you decided to not buy it?

mainquest: Does your organisation install all operating software updates and patches in a timely manner?
questb: How often is software updates? What is the process for installing updates?

mainquest: Has your organisation identified which systems are critical to the agency's operations?
questa: Has your organisation assessed the short and long-term consequences of losing control of these assets?
questb: Has your organisation made an effort to calculate the cost of  losing control of these critical assets for a few hours or a few days?

mainquest: Has your organisation inventoried of its physical devices, systems, software platforms, and applications?
questa: If yes, can we see the inventory list?
questb: If not, what are the challenges to doing so?

mainquest: Are all organisations data systems securely backed up?
questa: If so, where and how are they backed up?
questb: Who has access to the back ups (and how)?
questc: Which of the organisation's data are not backed up/cannot be backed up and why?

mainquest: Is access to critical systems carefully managed with only those who require access given access?
questb: What are the criteria for determining who is given access?

mainquest: Are there services and assets that depend on external entities (i.e. outsourcing, vendors, etc.) that pose cyberattack risks?
questa: If so, what are the related risks?
questb: Do you have an agreement to clarify who bears the responsibility if an attack happens through the external channels?

mainquest: Is there a comprehensive system shut  down plan in place in case of a ransomware attack?
questa: Do all employees know what  to do if there is such an attack?
questc: Have you tested the plan to assess its effectiveness?

mainquest: Has your organisation conducted a cost-benefit analysis to determine whether the organisation should pay any ransom and negotiate with attacks to recover data?
questa: If yes, does your organisation have pre-approved negotiation procedures and ransom limits?
questb: Can we see the cost/benefit analysis?
questc: Who is in charge of such a negotiation?
questd: Has this happened yet at your agency?

mainquest: Does your agency have an incident review process?
questa: Can we see the incident review plan?
